text.div:
FocalDevice Logical Model

A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (e.g., calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

name: FocalDevice
title: shr-core-FocalDevice
description: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (e.g., calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

element.definition: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (e.g., calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

element.short: A specific durable physical device used in diagnosis or treatment. The value is the coding for a type of device, for example, a CPAP machine. The same device might be used on multiple patients.
element.definition:
A specific durable physical device used in diagnosis or treatment. The value is the coding for a type of device, for example, a CPAP machine. The same device might be used on multiple patients.
Device status cannot be reconciled between Argonaut and US-Core, each having different required value sets.
Device type has extensible mappings to different value sets in Argonaut and US-Core, however both value sets have identical SNOMED content (descendants of 49062001 (Device). We adopt the US-Core value set, which is allowable because the binding is extensible.

element.short: The kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.
element.definition: The kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.
